tweet: As I told @cfordwtva, Senator Thad Cochran was a giant in the United States Senate. It is just amazing to think of what his life has meant for Mississippi. Watch my full interview with @wtva9news here ⤵ https://www.wtva.com/content/video/510629302.html …

Gayle and I were saddened to learn this morning of the passing of our friend and my former colleague, Senator Thad Cochran. I am grateful and honored to have known him, learned from him, and been his friend. America is a better country because of Thad Cochran. pic.twitter.com/ohqkNQIiC1

Thad Cochran was a giant in the United States Senate and one of the greatest champions Mississippi has ever known. My wife, Gayle, and I extend our heartfelt condolences to the Cochran family at this time. My full statement.  ⤵  https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/5/wicker-statement-on-u-s-senator-thad-cochran … pic.twitter.com/1CpjcjLuIi

Working together, the @USACEHQ, the @NatlParkService, and other agencies are improving the Gulf Coast for generations to come. Ship Island will provide greater protection from future hurricanes, serving as a natural barrier to the force of these storms.
This morning I spoke at the groundbreaking ceremony for the newly-restored Ship Island. The island is being rebuilt decades after being split in two by Hurricane Camille. pic.twitter.com/dQFdEpvHx7

I just received a few more great photos from my visit to @MS_Boysstate. One of the best parts about Boys State is the memories you will make here. I still stay in touch with the friends I made when I attended as a delegate from Pontotoc years ago. pic.twitter.com/vy0PfTePZN
